results.title: From Glasgow Green to Bendigo
results.creator_credit: Robert Irvine, Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: The design, manufacture and export of carpets. Highly skilled craftsment in a Glasgow factory are seen creating carpets from the basic design through intricate processes to the finished article. Carpets made for the Coronation, the White House, government buildings in New Zealand, South Africa and Rhodesia and in private homes, including one in Bendigo, Victoria.

results.title: From generation to generation
results.brief_description: The behaviour of the reproductive cells (wherein according to one theory the determinants of heredity are thought to be contained), together with the division of the nucleus in ordinary cell division, and the formation of reproductive cells, are illustrated by animated diagrams. Fertilization is explained by both animation and direct photography, and examples of the basic Mendelian principles of segregation and recombination are shown in rabbits, guinea pigs, and cattle. The white angora rabbit and the single-combed fowl are used as examples of the emergence of new types from the crossing of parents exhibiting independent pairs of Mendelian characteristics. The results of selective breeding of horses and dogs are also shown.

results.title: From dusk till dawn
results.creator_credit: Robert Rodriguez, Meir Teper, Gianni Nunnari and A Band Apart
results.brief_description: After pulling off a bloody Texas bank heist, notorious bank robber Seth Gecko and his homicidal, rape-happy brother Ritchie, secure a safe passage across the border into Mexico thanks to the unwilling aid of disillusioned ex-minister Jacob Fuller. After kidnapping the Fuller family, the Gecko brothers elude the authorities and reach a supposed safe haven at a pre-chosen site: a surreal and ultra-sleazy bar in the middle of the desert, where they plan to split the loot with their Mexican connection. Unfortunately, the club is actually a haven for ferocious Aztec vampires; a twist which spins the schizophrenic plot into its second phase. Cast includes George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Harvey Keitel and Juliette Lewis.

results.title: From Doric to Gothic
results.creator_credit: Andre Gillet, Marcel De Hubsch and Brandon Films
results.brief_description: This film reviews the development of architectural forms from the basic column and lintel construction of Greek temples, through the Roman basilica style and Romanesque churches to the groining and buttressing of Gothic cathedrals. The importance of development of arch and the later lightening of structural appearance is pointed out. The film makes use of animation, plans, scale models and actual scenes of buildings and exteriors, including some French cathedrals.

results.title: From creeping to walking
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Based on the work of Dr Arnold Gesell at the Yale Clinic of Child Development. Analyses mechanics of locomotion and the stages by which the infant gradually attains an upright, walking posture. Points out various stages where natural, unassisted infant action makes for best progress. Illustrates how attained abilities are related and how some are normal outgrowths of others.

results.title: From box kite to swing wing
results.brief_description: In 1914 the Australian Army started a flying school at Point Cook. The trainees took ten hours to learn to fly a Box Kite Plane. This video documents the history of air defence force planes from this humble beginning to their inclusion in World War I through to the sophisticated jet fighters that are the pride of the Royal Australian Air Force today.

results.title: From 5 to 7.30
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Read and American Temperance Society
results.brief_description: Shows the effect that drinking parents can have on their children. Joe is deeply disturbed when one of his schoolmates, because of his drinking, is involved in a motor car accident. His conviction is strengthened because he see the results of social drinking and “the cocktail hour” in his own home, and in that of his girl-friend. He seeks advice from his coach at school, and attends a lecture by Dr Andrew C. Ivy, which results in his decision to “leave it alone”.
